result.execSummary:
The defendant Clyde M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine in the amount of $200.00 by 08-11-2016 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Pay all applicable court costs and fees by 08-11-2016 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge
With credit for 3 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clyde M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letters in support of Clyde Smith, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by 8/11/2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $200.00 by 8/11/2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties are notified that effective March 7, 2016, this case will be assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Patrick Wait informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 2/26/2016.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense requests an adjourned date.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.   Pleas and sentencing scheduled on February 25, 2016 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties are still under negotiations.  Defense requests an adjourned date.  Court grants request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait. Morgan Wilz, student intern, under the supervision of Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case was previously called at 10:06am, and at that time, the defendant failed to appear for reasons stated on the record.  At the the present time the defendant is present in court.  Court lifted the previously stayed warrant.  Defense requested a projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court appearing via telephone.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Arrorney Wait informed the Court that per his calendar, the matter is supposed to be scheduled for 08/27/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 23.  For this reason the court imposed and stayed a warrant until the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Morgan Wills, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Clyde M Smith in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 45  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6-24-2015 at 1:30pm
